articles.title: Gas prices plunge as flotilla of tankers heads for Europe - Telegraph.co.uk
articles.description: Milder forecasts for early January have also pushed down prices that soared to new highs this week
articles.content:
At least 15 tankers filled with natural gas are steaming across the Altantic to replenish depleted European supplies, sending prices tumbling for the third day.

articles.title: Europe's bizarre rules for Covid-19 vaccine passes - News24
articles.description: Efforts in Europe to encourage vaccine use through certificates proving vaccination, a negative test result or evidence of having had Covid have created a mountain of regulation.
articles.content:
• Going to a petrol station in Lithuania requires a Covid-19 pass.
  • The unvaccinated in Greece must produce a rapid test result to attend church.

articles.title: Astronomers discover largest group of 'rogue planets' yet - The Verge
articles.description: Telescopes from the European Southern Observatory and other facilities caught a glimpse of dozens of rogue planets not tethered to stars. Using 20 years' worth of data, the telescopes were able to spot at least 70 planets while they were still hot enough to g…
articles.content:
Several billion of these free-floating giants could exist
An artists impression of a rogue planet 
Image: ESO/M. Kornmesser
